etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin medica, from Greek Mēdikē (poa) ‘Median (grass)’

definitions: a plant of the pea family related to alfalfa, some kinds of which are grown for fodder or green manure and some kinds of which are troublesome weeds.

notes.text: Genus Medicago, family Leguminosae: several species, including the prostrate black medick (M. lupulina)

shortDefinitions: yellow-flowered Eurasian and African plant of pea family related to alfalfa
